pros: Friendly and welcoming environment at the playgroup
cons: It could offer employees more flexible working hours but still great

review_title: It depends on who you are and who you know in regards to
pros: People are nice and very accepting of everyone. Work/Life is pretty good. If you have a nice manager
cons: The AFSCME UNION is horrible. Unless you belong to a certain group, do not expect any type of promotion, regardless of how well you work. Faculty are a little out of control. Hopefully, the new president can fix Pres. Nelson's mistakes.
nothing bad to say good place

review_title: One of the Best Places to Work
pros: Great culture , great opportunities to grow artistically. Professionally, I was surrounded by intelligent, caring and very creative people. It is a place where students and faculty are challenged in a positive way, contributing the the growth of the human being as well as artist. This creates a strong and vibrant community.   This, for me, is important in improving the life on a global level.
cons: It is difficult for me to even think of a downside. I thrived artistically, personally and emotionally here. I enjoy the challenge of personal growth and was always pleasantly surprised at cicumstances that some might consider negative, I could always find a positive light in which to view the incident....It was such a rare occasion, that it offered growth potential rather than detriment

pros: This college has an amazing community and makes you feel valued. My time spent there helped me further my career as a photographer and enabled me to connect with a lot of amazing people.
cons: Working at the school was only a part time position and there wasn't that much room to grow to a full time position which is what I would have liked

review_title: Great experience for those interested in the arts
pros: Great access to a variety of art forms. Management is wonderful - very friendly, approachable. Tasks are varied and so you don't suffer from monotonous routines.
cons: I honestly couldn't think of any. The job offers great exposure to those interested in working in a contemporary gallery. The pay is lacking, but its to be expected for an entry level position.

pros:
Collaborative, supportive culture
Inspiring, talented students
Great benefits
Great staff and faculty who are passionate about the mission
Distinctive place - only publicly supported free standing college of art and design in the country
cons:
Terrible President
Unions make it impossible to get rid of inept or toxic staff
State government bureaucracy

review_title: WONDERFUL PLACE TO WORK! Great people!
pros: Great people to work with! Shared goals make it easy to work together.
cons: Union Dues and Hard to get Promotions!

pros: Casual work environment, friendly staff. Benefits include 403b, pension plan, healthcare, dental, Union membership and tuition remission at any Proarts or COF schools.
cons: Small office, little space, can get awkward. Very old building - mice and ants problem.

pros: A fun way to get involved in the community.
cons: Quite unstructured for the amount of work that always needs to be done.

pros: They were flexible with my schedule.
cons: There tends to be a lack of organization.
